common_errors.pattern: must be of type|validation failed|configuration is invalid
causes: Config value doesn't match schema type
solutions: Check schema definition for expected type
Provide default value in schema
Set value via env var, arg, or config file
Use format: '*' for any type if needed

causes: Custom format not registered before use
solutions: Use built-in formats: String, Number, Boolean, url, email, etc.
Register custom format with convict.addFormat()
Check format name spelling
Register formats before creating config schema

common_errors.pattern: env var.*wrong type|string instead of number|boolean as string
causes: Type coercion not happening as expected
solutions: Convict auto-coerces env vars to schema type
Ensure format is specified in schema
Use format: 'int' or 'nat' for integers
Check convict version (older versions had bugs)

common_errors.pattern: Cannot load config file|ENOENT.*config|JSON parse error
solutions: Check file exists at specified path
Validate JSON/YAML syntax
Use absolute path or path relative to cwd
Make config file optional with try-catch

causes: Sensitive property not marked as such
solutions: Add sensitive: true to schema for secrets
Use config.toString() which redacts sensitive values
Never log config.get('secret') directly
Use config.getProperties() with custom filtering
Ensure schema keys are unique
Use consistent nesting structure
Define base schema first, extend with addSchema()
Check for typos in nested property paths
